intro: Rubus thyrsoideus var. constrictiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flowered blackberry, is a species of bramble native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and have a distinctive constricted floral tube. The fruit is a dark purple to black berry, typically edible and used in culinary applications. This variant is often found in coastal areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
